content: the blanket pictured is knitted with worsted weight cotton i e dish cloth yarn i like cotton for babies because it is soft and won t itch even on the most sensitive skin however the pattern works equally well with other fibers the pattern stands out the best with variegated or self-striping yarns you can also use two colours to create stripes knit row 1-7 of the pattern with one colour and row 8-12 with another finished size 28 x 30 gauge 18 sts / 4 10cm not too important yarn bernat handicrafter cotton 620m / 680 yd 400g needles 5 5mm / us 9 here s what you do co 116 sts knit three row next row starts the pattern row 1 k3 k2tog k2 kfb twice k3 ssk until the last 3 sts k3 row 2 4 and 6 k3 purl until the last 3 sts k3 row 3 5 and 7 repeat row 1 row 8-12 knit repeat the pattern until the blanket is 30 long or desired length knit three row and bobble adjusting the size of the blanket is easy the pattern works in multiples of 11 stitches so add or subtract the number of stitches as desired this pattern would look lovely as a scarf as well as an afghan this pattern is based on the welting fantastic stitch by barbara walker a treasury of knitting patterns p 143
